Title: SORT: Update "Sales Contribution" calculation for Industry X and Song values
Description:
As an APM I want to modify the existing Sales Contribution logic in order to include the calculation for one user that have Industry X and Song contributions at the same time.

The new value for "Sales Contribution Based on:" column should be "Song - Industry X".

Scenario: 

As most of you are aware, we maintain a list of people who are treated as if their Service/Group Level 1 = “Song” or “Industry X” so that the Sales Contribution Based on field is reflected as “Song” or “Industry X” if their Service/Group Level 1 value from MRDR is not “Song” or “Industry X”.  One scenario where we do this is if the person was aligned to Song or Industry X earlier in the fiscal year, but they transferred to a different Service/Group during the year but we still want to count the Sales Capture-Song or Sales Capture-Industry X role toward their sales contribution.  

Under this new scenario, we have an MD (ben.carl) who moved from Industry X to Song in the middle of the year.  As a result, we want to count both the Sales Capture-Song role and the Sales Capture-Industry X role toward his sales contribution.  Currently the Sales Capture-Song role is counting toward his sales contribution because his Service/Group Level 1 = “Song”.  I expect if I submit a ticket to you to treat him as if he was aligned to Industry X, the Sales Capture-Song role would no longer count for him.  Is there a way we can make it such that both Sales Capture-Song and Sales Capture-Industry X will count for him?  While this is the first time I have seen this scenario, it is possible that it could happen with other people.

SELECT ServiceGroupLevel1,ServiceGroupLevel2,* FROM [2766_SalesDW].DW.FactHRData
WHERE EmployeeEmail = 'ben.carl@accenture.com'
Acceptance Criteria:
Hi @Mlawski, Neil S. The fix was already applied on Breakfix environment --> https://sort-rel.ciostage.accenture.com/HomePage.aspx

Employee ID (Not Enterprise ID): 11446331 
Datekey: 25-Dec-2023

Title: [SF] Contacts - Last Event Fields - Update Logic
Description:
Currently, the "Last Event" fields in Contact are updated based on the latest event related to a contact.  The new requirement is to update the logic of the last event fields to also consider the emails related to the contact.  

Last Event fields:
  • LastEvent__c  (Displays hyperlink to event with subject)
  • LastEventAssignedTo__c
  • LastEventContactedBy__c  (assigned to + date)
  • LastEventDetails__c
  • LastEventDt__c
  • LastEventId__c
  • LastEventSubject__c

Conversion should be done for around 722 contacts in production.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Rename the "Last Event" fields to "Last Interaction".
  • Update the logic of the last event fields to consider both emails and events related to the contact.

No

FY23 BAU Performance Testing Task per Quarterly Release

Description

Type

1

NBM - 4 Region * 17 Transactions * 4 Iterations each

17 Transactions * 4 Iterations each from 4 regions

Quarterly - BAU

  • MMS Performance Testing Data Setup
  • MMS Perf Testing from 4 Region
  • Defects Retesting

Title: [SOD] Activities - Slack Elevate - Update Log a Call global action
Description:
As Slack Elevate user I would like to create activities adding all necessary details so that I have the same experience than creating them from MMS UI.

Slack Elevate uses Log a Call SF standard Global Action to log activities. By default, this global action doesn't recover all Tasks fields that we have in our org, so we need to add the missing fields in the Global Action Layout. 

For this, the following steps are required:

  1. Go to MMS setup and look for Global Actions
  2. Edit the Log a Call global Action. There are 2, the correct one is the global action not installed by a managed app:
       3. Click on Layout and drag a drop the fields in the following order:
Acceptance Criteria: Log a Call global Action layout look as:

Title: [.NET] Opp - DPR Insights- Creation of DPR metrics in MMS
Description:
LINK TO US DOCUMENT

AS DPR user,
I WANT TO have new fields in MMS object,
SO THAT we can use the information provided by these fields to analyze/build new metrics in DPR Dashboard Insights tab
Acceptance Criteria:
• When I enter to MMS, I should be able to see 30 new fields:
    • Start ADR
    • Market Mid ADR
    • Floor ADR
    • Variance to Mid ADR
    • Variance to Floor ADR
    • ADR Position DSP
    • ADR Position Desc DSP
    • ADR Position
    • ADR Position Desc
    • Start CCI
    • Market Mid CCI
    • Floor CCI
    • Variance to Mid CCI
    • Variance to Floor CCI
    • CCI Position DSP
    • CCI Position Desc DSP
    • CCI Position
    • CCI Position Desc
    • Bundle
    • Competitor Type
    • Deal Construct
    • Pricing Deal Size
    • Main Location
    • On-Offshore Mix
    • Pyramid Level
    • Money Left on The Table
    • Money Left on the Floor
    • Recommended Action for DSP
    • Recommended Action
    • Hours/Day
  • When I enter to MMS, profiles will have read/write access to fields mentioned above. Profiles impacted are:
    • MMS Admin     
    • Analytics Clouds Integration User          
    • MMS Client Team         
    • DF API - Only Integration          
    • API-Only Integration     
    • System Administrator

  • When I enter to MMS, i should be able to see the 32 fields populated with MMP data:
    • Start ADR
    • Market Mid ADR
    • Floor ADR
    • Variance to Mid ADR
    • Variance to Floor ADR
    • ADR Position DSP
    • ADR Position Desc DSP
    • ADR Position
    • ADR Position Desc
    • Start CCI
    • Market  Mid CCI
    • Floor CCI
    • Variance to Mid CCI
    • Variance to Floor CCI
    • CCI Position DSP
    • CCI Position Desc DSP
    • CCI Position
    • CCI Position Desc
    • Bundle
    • Competitor Type
    • Deal Construct
    • Pricing Deal Size
    • Main Location
    • On-Offshore Mix
    • Pyramid Level
    • Money Left on The Table
    • Money Left on the Floor
    • Recommended Action for DSP
    • Recommended Action
    • Hours/Day

Title: POC UI: Competitive Intelligence -Competitor Comparison[Competitor Landscape] [Client Industry & Position] [AP]
Description: User should have selected Competitor Comparison in Competitor Landscape filter
Acceptance Criteria:
User is logged into the website: XYZ
User should be able to view the welcome message as " Welcome to TBD" in the header.
User should be able to see the tagline "Powered by Sales Excellence"

User should be able to see two tabs: 
  1. Account Planning
  2. Competitive Intelligence
User should be able to click on Competitive Intelligence tab.

The below dropdown filters should be visible:
Client Filter

CLIENT SNAPSHOT filter
SALES TRIGGERS filter
CLIENT SPENDING filter
COMPETITOR LANDSCAPE
TECHNOLOGY LANDSCAPE
SOCIALYTICS
SALES PERFORMANCE ANALYZER
INDUSTRY INSIGHTS 
CONTRACT DATABASE

User should be able to click on Client Filter and the list of client accounts should be displayed.
User should be able to select Competitor Landscape and the below options should be displayed:
    • Incumbents
    • Workloads
    • Competitor Comparison
User should  be able to select Competitor Comparison and the following questions should appear:

Who are the top competitors to watch?

How does each one compete and compare to your client?

Title: [POC] [SF] CX - Research of alerts triggered for  UNABLE_TO_LOCK_ROW in CS_SurveyStatusBatch
Description:
There are some alerts triggered by Splunk regarding UNABLE_TO_LOCK_ROW for CS_SurveyStatusBatch (see attachment)
Creating this ADO item to investigate the root cause and address a solution
Acceptance Criteria:
RCA: When a record is being updated or created, Salesforce places a lock on that record to prevent another operation from updating the record at the same time and causing inconsistencies on the data.

These locks normally last for a few seconds and when the lock is released, other operations can do whatever processing they are supposed to do on the record in question. However, a given transaction can only wait a maximum of 10 seconds for a lock to be released, otherwise, it will time out and throw the – Unable to Lock Row Error.

So, to resolve the same we are analyzing the logic of the batch class with tech arch and performing unit testing in lower env.

Title: [EM] [Agile] Opportunity -New object field generation to store predictions of WPP model
Description:
Post release in December 2023, it was noted that the dynamic component, created by the CIO (positioned as the top component) on the insights page, was not fetching the latest WPP scores.

Detailed investigation with CIO and Salesforce support team assisted in finding the root cause- "row lock errors" encountered while attempting to write predictions. Salesforce support mentioned that they have observed similar occurrences with other customers and suspect it might be due to numerous processes firing on the same object where predictions are written back.

 

Business Solution- Generate a new object in MMS to store the predictions directly on any other appropriate object field instead of using WPP New score plus field from Opportunity object

 

List of tasks to be involved:

1) Tech team to guide how to generate a new field on non-Opportunity object i.e WPP_EDD Outome object to directly store predictions

2) Model to be re-tested with above field - requesting environment allocation to test the feasibility. The environment should provide option to re-design the output as per latest production/ ops support sandbox environment.

3) Analytics team to review existing recipe in production and provide optimized solution (reduce number of recipes from 5 to may be just 1 or 2) to save system run time on regular intervals
Acceptance Criteria:
Significant reduction in score mismatch issue with Bulk scoring (<20%)
Significant reduction in overall recipe refresh run time (1/4 of current execution time)

Title: [EM] [Offcycle] Opportunity - Scheduling WPP Model reference to old Dec'23 release user story
Description:
With the previous user story wrt Opportunity - Retraining and Refreshing the WPP Model (https://dev.azure.com/accenturecio20/SELL_PR1011/_workitems/edit/350934)

some of the model refresh setting options were not enabled(which we realized is not allowing backend data integration on regular intervals)

resulting in no-updates to real time scores with field changes as implemented by users.

 

Hence it would be great to add a child reference to the old user story and re-deploy the model in production off cycle with immediate effect-

 

Business Criticality- Users can’t see updated scores since the model doesn’t allow data from all objects to integrate without recipe refresh and scheduler (Please find the email attached)

 

List of tasks to be involved:

1) Proposed Name of reference user story- ‘Scheduling WPP Model reference to old user story’

2) One time Recipe(re-run) + model refresh then opt in for auto schedule (To allow latest data integration of all related Objects i.e Opportunity+ Supplement objects immediately and going forward)

3) Weekly auto schedule job (could be every Tuesday off time)

 

 

Recipes to be refreshed and auto scheduled:

  • Trial_Additional_WPP_Variable
  • GreaterThan5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipleline_Prod_Q124
  • GT5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipleline_ALL_OPPS_Q124
  • LT5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipeline_Prod_Q124

Title: [TEST][Monitoring Application] AWS Monitoring Application Configured For Sharepoint Reporting
Description:
Description:

In the flow of the surveys through the monitoring process, both MMS and Qualtrics send their information to the Data Fabric which will send it to DynamoDB. The data sent should be stored in DynamoDB within the correct tables/in the correct schema. Here the MonitoringStatus should be listed as 'New'  

The data is then sent to the Monitoring Application to check for direct matches. 

The Monitoring Application will look for a survey match from MMS and a Survey match from Qualtrics - 

IF a match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Closed'

IF NO match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Active' 

 

 Once the Monitoring Application has run:

-Historical SharePoint List - this list is all records that ran through the app in the last 24 hour period regardless of Monitoring Status. (Sharepoint site linked below)

-Active Discrepancies Report - this report contains all records that have a MonitoringStatus of 'Active' and is updated every 24 hours. (Sharepoint site linked below)
Acceptance Criteria:
Acceptance Criteria:
-Daily Batch Job to upload historical report to historical SharePoint List - this list is all records that ran through the app in the last 24 hour period regardless of Monitoring Status. (Sharepoint site linked below) (See Schema attachment for format)

-Daily Batch Job that updates Active Discrepancies Report daily - this report contains all records that have a MonitoringStatus of 'Active' and is updated every 24 hours. (Sharepoint site linked below) (See Schema attachment for format)

Example of generated report:

Title: [Analysis] Qualtrics Engage data structure, 3rd-party access, & exportability (part 2)
Description:
Part 1 covered analysis of the Accounts Dashboard.  Part 2 will cover the remaining analysis for the Accounts Dashboard and all of the Projects Dashboard.

This analysis story is requested to better understand what data could be extracted from the Qualtrics CS instance and push to the Data Lake.

Need to determine:
  1. What are the stored data tables/objects in Qualtrics that customers have access to via APIs or Export capabilities
  2. Determine what fields are user inputs, calculated, or meta-data
  3. Determine what analysis results can be exported (ie Sentiment, Topics, etc.)

Similar to the work we did for Friction. 


Question: Engage or Discover?

If we can convert this? 
What are the impacts of the conversion?

Title: [SEC] Opp -Copilot for Sales - Permission for Expected Revenue field in Opportunity obj
Description:
As CIO MMS team I want to update the 'read access' permission for Expected Revenue field in Opportunity obj for MMS Admin, Client Team and SysAdmin profiles with the below details:

Profile Name: MMS Admin

  1. In MMS, click on the Setup Icon
  2. Under ‘Quick Find’, search for ‘profiles’ and click on it

  3. In the ‘All Profiles’ List view, press the ‘M’ and click on ‘MMS Admin’.

  4. Click on ‘Object Settings’

  5. Find ‘Opportunities’ and click on it
  6. Click on the ‘Edit’ button and in the ‘Field Permissions’ section, find the ‘Expected Revenue’ field, and mark ‘Read Access’ as true, then click on save

  2. Under ‘Quick Find’, search for ‘profiles’ and click on it

  5. Find ‘Opportunities’ and click on it

  6. Click on the ‘Edit’ button and in the ‘Field Permissions’ section, find the ‘Expected Revenue’ field, and mark ‘Read Access’ as true, then click on save

Profile Name: System Administrator
  1. In MMS, click on the Setup Icon
  2. Under ‘Quick Find’, search for ‘profiles’ and click on it
  3. In the ‘All Profiles’ List view, press the ‘S’ and click on ‘System Administrator’
  4. Click on ‘Object Settings’
  5. Find ‘Opportunities’ and click on it

1- Friday datekeys for the last Q for the current FY
Name of this new view: [2766_SalesDW].DWR.EVPlayAllocations_FY_Q_Friday_vw
2- QEnds datekeys for the last 3 FYs + Current FY (24/23/22/21)

Name of this new view: [2766_SalesDW].DWR.EVPlayAllocations_QEnd_vw

Impacted datekeys: 

ROM [2766_SalesDW].DW.DimDate (NOLOCK)
WHERE REPORTINGDATEFISCALYEARNBR IN (2021,2022,2023)
AND ReportingDateFiscalQuarterNbr IN (1,2,3,4)
GROUP BY ReportingDateFiscalYearNbr,ReportingDateFiscalQuarterNbr
ORDER BY 1,2
FY24 (Current) --> One datekey per Month (Friday of each week) (20240105,20240112,20240119,20240126)
FY23 --> QEnd Datekeys (20221206,20230306,20230606,20230906)
FY22 --> QEnd Datekeys (20211203,20220304,20220606,20220906)
FY21 --> QEnd Datekeys (20201204,20210304,20210607,20210906)
Acceptance Criteria:
1- When I open the database, I see a new DWR view called [2766_SalesDW].DWR.EVPlayAllocations_QE_vw.
2- When I open the new view, I see the structure matches with the existing [2766_SalesDW].DWR.EVPlayAllocations_vw.
3- When I open the new view, I see the Quarter end datekeys for the last 3 fiscal years (21,22,23), additionally the last Friday datekeys for the last Month.

Title: [TEST] Contacts - Restricted Contacts - Security & Reports
Description:
There are Contacts in MMS that requires an additional layer of security due to legal restrictions. Different solutions where discussed (Attached) and the short-term solution is to create a private object to support those private contacts with the following functionalities:
  • Private Object 
  • Fields: required fields of Contact object
  • Activities enabled
  • Security based on a permission set and MC ATR
  • Only available at MC level
  • Duplicate Rules- Should mimic the Contact Duplicate rules (Business is aware that this will not cross over with the Contact rules so possible to have a duplicate in the contact object and same as this object)

  • Integration – Confirmed No Integration for initial release

  • One Trust - Plan to include this process with the custom object (I’ve discussed with Nacho he thinks it is doable but will be sending up follow up email to one trust cio person and Stephen)  Of note business has not confirmed this process will be necessary but want us to proceed with planning as if it will be confirmed.

This story covers chapters 4 and 9
Acceptance Criteria:
Create a custom Private Contact object displayed in a new related list at MC level that is only accessible for limited amount of users.
These limited users will see the new related list and depending on the access they will C/R/E or D records in it. They will also see existing contacts list. Rest of users will see just the existing contacts list as today.

Title: Update SEA Datasets production to be able to re-process old periods - Forecast Version By Planning Element
Description:
When we took over the code for the Self Enabled Analytics datasets, we realized that their current code does not offer the possibility of re-processing anything but the very last production period. 

This is a problem as the expectation is that as we get more clients, they will find Bugs that required us fixing data for older periods. Ideally, we would like to have the possibility to re-process those older periods because we will not always have the chance to fix existing data (like for instance when we had the issue with missing TBD resources in the Resource Trend table because of a badly implemented filter in the Country field looking for Germany).

The ideal solution would let us enter the period to be re-processed as a parameter, also allowing us to leave it blank in case we want to go for a standard production.

We also have the requirement to support the possibility of re-processing all data in the SEA tables. So, alternatively, we could simply have an additional  parameter that forces reprocessing of ALL periods, or two parameters instead of the one proposed above, so we have a "startPeriod" and an "endPeriod" couple of parameters.

The final decision on how to implement both requirements should come at the time you are doing technical design:
  • One paramenter with the period to re-process and we simply call the process several times if we have to re-process the entire table.
  • Two parameters with the StartPeriod and the EndPeriod to re-process (they could point to the same period if it is just one period to be re-processed).
  • One parameter with the period to re-process plus one additional parameter with a "ProcessALL" flag, which ignores the first parameter and simply reprocess all periods in the table.
Acceptance Criteria: The production of the SEA table can accept parameters (or looks for a table or server variables) the indicate the period or periods to be re-processed.

Title: MMP Redshift interface Decommission | laborplanresourcestore_monthlydistributions_published_vw ETL to VW
Description:
As a Dev team, we need to review and update "ETL Tables" to "VW Tables" laborplanresourcestore_monthlydistributions_published_vw code.

Source table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.laborplanresourcestore_monthlydistributions
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_vw_5066_tmp.versionstore_published_vw
Destination table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_vw_5066_tmp.laborplanresourcestore_monthlydistributions_published_vw

- Re-create the table to reflect the latest structure updates.

You can find the Primary Key in the following script: New_MMP_rawvalidations.sql

Note: versionstore_published_vw should be the first table we load in order to pick the correct data, the rest of the tables need to be loaded after it and use it to filter versions.

As reference, find the table schema in the following link: 02_redshift_views_creation - prod.sql - Repos (azure.com)


Redshift decomission documentation:

Title: Account Plan: Site Feedback
Description:
User should be able to click on Site Feedback button anda popup should appear with questions as per attached.

A Send Feedback button must be present upon clicking should send a  mail to Cal Dev group.
Acceptance Criteria:
User should be able to login the CAL Assist website:

  • On the Home page, in the Header section user should be able to click on Site Feedback button and a popup should appear as per attached.
  • User should be able to verify that Site Feedback button is now present next to Meet the Team button in the Header section.
  • Site Feedback button should resemble the Meet the Team button[font, color etc]
  •  Site Feedback : In popup it should be placed in the center of the popup.
  • Only the Your Suggestion field is mandatory rest are all optional questions.
  • Cancel button should be placed next to Send Feedback on the lefthandside.
  • A Cross mark should be included at the top right corner of the popup.
  • Both Cross mark and Cancel are used to close the popup and revert to Home screen.
  • User should fill the details in Your Suggestion textbox and click on Send Feedback button.
  • A mail is triggered to CAL Dev Group.

Title: Implement Rerank: For Client Stories
Description:
Requirements Section


Context from the opportunity - Business context + other text fields, -> goes ada -> ada returns a vector for the text-> similar deals each, takes fields -> ada -> vector-> similar two vectors (cosine similarity) -> rerank similarity based on cosine similarity (semantic similarity)
Acceptance Criteria: Successfull implementation of embedding model for search rerank

Title: Extension Restore Resources in Sandbox and update the pipelines
Description:
• Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Resource Group and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Key Vault and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Storage Account and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Blob Storage and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of App Insights and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Create OpenAI CI and CD pipeline and ensure it is deployed in the portal (Earlier it was manually created).
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Cosmos DB and ensure it is deployed in the portal.
  • Trigger CI and CD pipeline of Function App and ensure it is deployed in the portal.

 

-Update the script of Function App and implement below:-

Cors policy – the old urls beginning with cmp can be removed from the cors policy, the following urls should be added:

https://nbcoach.ciodev.accenture.com

https://nbcoach.ciostage.accenture.com

https://nbcoach.accenture.com

https://accenture--janagldev--c.sandbox.vf.force.com 

Config – 

There are several reused variables that can be condensed if we update the code.

The following variables contain the same data:

account_name and ci_account_name

account_key and ci_account_key

container_name and ci_container_name

database_name and COSMOS_DATABASE_NAME

 

Need the following added to config:

CosmosDbConnectionString – this is the same as ci_connection_string, however it is specific to a config file Mei-Chi needs

oauth_url =  https://login.microsoft.com/f3211d0e-125b-42c3-86db-322b19a65a22/oauth2/token

oauth_client_id = "22e3e7f7-3fa3-4c31-b8b5-33f0da473645" 

oauth_client_secret = "Mst8Q~tBpaO9Go6rXgrZ8.B6h~pAtyB~G.v1.a21" 

oauth_scope = "1df48c4c-72b0-4938-802e-6a0cefa121ad/.default" 

oauth_resource = "1df48c4c-72b0-4938-802e-6a0cefa121ad" 

search_url =  https://api.search.ciostage.accenture.com/clienttype/api/kaleidoscope_kx_cs_stg/_search

 

There are several files listed in the config such as ci_blob = Document_Catalog.csv which are not properly cased in blob. In blob the name was document_catalog.csv. Due to the casing issue, function app cannot locate the file.  Winloss_blob_name was set to extracted_reasons_11k_20231109_curated_flattened_FULLWINLOSS.csv in the config, but was renamed in blob as winlossdata.csv.

 

These files were also suffering from casing issues between the config and blob. 

CompetitorPerformanceAnalyzerData.xlsx  

OppotunityData_with_Technology.csv  

OppotunityData_with_Technology.xlsx  

 

-Update script for storage account:

  1. Queue needs to be created called replies.
  2. Additional Blob container needs to be created called token-cache.
  1. questions and conversation-state containers need to be created with the question matrix file inside the questions container.

Make sure file names in blob and function app config are identical, including casing and files copies - (1) at the end of the file name.

 

-Update Script for Cosmos:-

Inside the nbmdatabase there is need of the following containers:

  1. summary_records – used for storing summary history.
  2. sw_results(partition key: session_id) – using for storing strength and weakness analysis.
  1. good_bad_answer_example  (partition key: id)
Acceptance Criteria: • Sandbox to be restored with the above given config

Title: NBM Automation-Project 5 - Integrate QA Fields from source to better identify status and completeness
NBM Automation-Project 5 - Integrate Legal Fields from source to better identify status and completeness
NBM Automation-Project 6- Integrate CDP Status field from Source
[SF] NBC- Embedding Bot UI in MMS
Description:
Requirements Section

This product would act as a coach and assistant for the approver during the NBM, providing insights, questions, and suggestions based on data and analytics. It would also provide a view on the strengths and weaknesses of the deal. The future of the product would act as a virtual approver that can ask and answer questions, pull data and insights, and provide a go-forward strategy for deals that would otherwise go to an NBM.
Acceptance Criteria: It will be feasible to support the UI components and functionality wise, if GenAI Chatbot client app components are embedded into MMS end.

Title: POC UI: Competitive Intelligence -Socialytics
Description: User should have selected Socialytics filter
Acceptance Criteria:
User is logged into the website: XYZ
User should be able to view the welcome message as " Welcome to TBD" in the header.
User should be able to see the tagline "Powered by Sales Excellence"

User should be able to see two tabs: 
  1. Account Planning
  2. Competitive Intelligence
User should be able to click on Competitive Intelligence tab.

The below dropdown filters should be visible:
Client Filter

CLIENT SNAPSHOT filter
SALES TRIGGERS filter
CLIENT SPENDING filter
COMPETITOR LANDSCAPE
TECHNOLOGY LANDSCAPE
SOCIALYTICS
SALES PERFORMANCE ANALYZER
INDUSTRY INSIGHTS 
CONTRACT DATABASE

User should be able to click on Client Filter and the list of client accounts should be displayed.
User should be able to click on Socialytics Filter and the below options should be displayed:
    • Social Monitoring
    • Intent Monitoring
User should select the dropdown option as : Social Monitoring/Intent Monitoring and the following questions should appear:

What are the Social Media Mentions and Sentiment trends and change from last period
What are the Search Intent trends and change from last period
What are the key search terms executives at the account are using?
What is the change and recent trends in the search term volumes?
Where are the executives located that are searching for these terms?

Title: Search - Rerank
Description:
Requirements Section


Context from the opportunity - Business context + other text fields, -> goes ada -> ada returns a vector for the text-> similar deals each, takes fields -> ada -> vector-> similar two vectors (cosine similarity) -> rerank similarity based on cosine similarity (semantic similarity)
Acceptance Criteria: Successfull implementation of embedding model for search rerank

Title: [Rekey] [SF] NBC- Creation of a Button to Open the Bot & Security Control and Visibility Control
Description:
Requirements Section


This product would act as a coach and assistant for the approver during the NBM, providing insights, questions, and suggestions based on data and analytics. It would also provide a view on the strengths and weaknesses of the deal. The future of the product would act as a virtual approver that can ask and answer questions, pull data and insights, and provide a go forward strategy for deals that would otherwise go to an NBM.


As part of this story, we need the BOT button on the checkout page, as shown below:

Button label = Open New Business Coach
Acceptance Criteria:
It will be feasible to support the UI components and functionality wise, if GenAI Chatbot client app components are embedded into MMS end. The button shoulf be visible on the UI to the following people.

User should be able to select an account:

User should be able to view the below details for the THREATS section in Client Industry & Position :

1. What is the competition doing?:
  • Describes the areas/services that the account is involved in. 
Ex:  Gartner Inc Account is involved in :'Professional Services', IT Services, 'Biotechnology', etc..
        Meta Platforms, Inc. is involved in : 'Media & Entertainment', 'Consumer Software', 'Enterprise Software' etc..

2. 2. What are the disruptors?

3. Are there key obstacles for this organization?

  • Denotes the disruptions and the impact caused for this account
Ex: For Microsoft Account: 
Disruptions : High chances of loss, damage of diagnosis reports, medical history due to use of paper based documents
Impact : EHR enables digitized access to patients medical history such as lab and imaging results, medications and diagnoses

For Google Inc. Account:
Disruptions : Inability to present right product and services to potential consumers leading to lower engagement levels
Impact : ~15% of the recommendations made by the engine is consumed by an individual

4. Are there financial considerations, strains, or pressures?

Title: MMP Redshift interface Decommission | lineitemstore and lineitemstore_cells RAW to ETL
Description:
As a Dev team, we need to review and update "RAW Tables" to "ETL Tables" lineitemstore and lineitemstore_cells code.

lineitemstore

Source table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.stage_mmp_4592_raw.lineitem
Destination table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.lineitemstore
lineitemstore_cells 

Source table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.stage_mmp_4592_raw.lineitem
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.lineitemstore
Destination table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.lineitemstore_cells

New partition and audit fields will be added
  • ingestiondttm
  • dlcreatedttm
  • dlcreateuserid
  • dlupdatedttm
  • dlupdateuserid
The table will be partitioned by ingestiondttm

As reference, find the table schema in the following link: 02_redshift_views_creation - prod.sql - Repos (azure.com)


In case of a discrepancy between Redshift base table schema and ETL script, we should create a list of impacted fields and leave in the folder Issues.


Redshift decomission documentation: 
MMP-Pricing Analytics Redshift Decommission.pptx
Acceptance Criteria:
• The query must run successfully.
  • All versions must be inserted.
  • No duplicated version ingested.

Title: MMP Redshift interface Decommission | lineitemstore_v1_cells_published_vw_delta ETL to VW
Description:
As a Dev team, we need to review and update "ETL Tables" to "VW Tables" lineitemstore_v1_cells_published_vw_delta code.

Source table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.lineitemstore
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_etl_5066_tmp.lineitemstore_cells
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_vw_5066_tmp.versionstore_published_vw
Destination table
  • npd-65343-datalake-bd-b4f8d566.pricinganalytics_vw_5066_tmp.lineitemstore_v1_cells_published_vw_delta
- Re-create the table to reflect the latest structure updates.

- As this is delta table, we should implement the logic to set the correct time window to pick the data.

You can find the Primary Key in the following script: New_MMP_rawvalidations.sql

Note: versionstore_published_vw should be the first table we load in order to pick the correct data, the rest of the tables need to be loaded after it and use it to filter versions.

As reference, find the table schema in the following link: 02_redshift_views_creation - prod.sql - Repos (azure.com)


Redshift decomission documentation: 
MMP-Pricing Analytics Redshift Decommission.pptx
Acceptance Criteria:
• The query must run successfully.
  • The last version based on the primary key must be inserted.
  • No duplicated version ingested.

Title: UI — Conversation Bubbles Styling
Description: As a UI Designer, I want the Coach and User conversation bubbles to have a polished aesthetic so that information delivered by the Coach can be easily understood and responses from the User can be clearly differentiated from the Coach.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Background colors, drop shadows and type styling need to be updated from what was completed in the POC code (see details in Figma)

  • Coach avatar should appear to the left of the Coach's chat bubbles (see difference in avatar placement between single and double bubble in Figma)

  • Users will NOT have an avatar associated with their responses (this leads to more padding on the user responses than the coach responses to keep the bubbles aligned)

  • The Coach should display various inline style elements beyond plain text (See "Inline Coach Cards" component in Figma, screenshot below)

    • Inline elements include Win/Loss Insights and Strategy, Competitive Insights and Strategy, Recommended Discussion Topics, Strength & Weakness Summary

    • Note: Strength & Weakness Summary styling has already been completed

    • Note: Inline Trends (shown in Figma) will NOT be included in this first release

  • All content delivered by the Coach is variable, none of the information is static

  • '3-dot' loading animation should appear while the Coach is processing it's response (placement and styling for animation can be found in Figma, see "Dot Animation" and "Master Chat Frame" components)

  • AI Feedback Rating component should be included at the bottom of the bubble when the coach delivers insights or summaries (front end only)

Title: UI — Prompt Pill Styling and Help Tooltip
Description: As a UI Designer, I want users to be able to respond quickly, and in a manner that aides the Coach in generating quality content, through the use of prompts as well as a tooltip that offers basic advice on how to interact with the coach.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Prompt pills appear above the user input field

  • Prompt pils have a default, hover and click state

  • Exactly 3 prompts will be displayed at any given time
    • "Prompt: [Variable Text Response]" — This option will populate a predefined response within the user input field, which the user can then edit to make more applicable to their opportunity. The user must press enter or the send icon to submit this response after editing, it will not be automatically sent. (Discuss with Mei-Chi or Jim to find/access variable responses)

    • "Strength & Weakness Summary" — This response will be automatically sent to the chat upon pressing the pill button. The Coach will then generate the Strength & Weakness Summary.

    • "Skip" — This response will be automatically sent to the chat upon pressing the pill button and allows the user to skip the question asked. The Coach will then ask a new question.

  • The "Help" icon sits to the right of the prompts (See "Prompts and Tooltip Bar" component in Figma)

  • Tooltip text is static

  • When tooltip is visible, it may overlap conversation bubbles

  • When a user hovers over the Help icon the tooltip appears. If possible, users should be able to hover over the tooltip to copy/paste the text.

Title: [SOD] Contact 360 - Add Subheader in Win Rate Tile
Description:
As a Contact administrator, I want to add a sub header in the Win Rate tile Level 1 and Level 2.  


Steps to reproduce:
  1. Open the environment
  2. Go to "Setup"
  3. Go to "Custom Metadata Types"
  4. Search for "Contact360 Tile Details" and click "Manage Records"
  5. Search for "Win Rate" and click "Edit"
  6. In "Tile Sub Heading" add "BASIS # OF DEALS"
  7. Finally click "Save"
Acceptance Criteria: The Level 1 and Level 2 Win Rate tiles should have "Basis # of deals" as a subheader.

Title: [SF] New Scheduler class designed to monitor the status of the "CS_SurveyStatusBatch"
Description: This US was created to check if there is a way to have a notification when CS job “CS_SurveyStatusBatch” is on Holding status for more than 2 time, So, we can take immediately action to reduce potential issues.
Acceptance Criteria:
solution proposed: 

Regarding the need to improve our monitoring reports as per your request for a notification system to alert us when our job "CS_SurveyStatusBatch" is in a Holding status for an extended period.

After discussing this requirement with our technical architecture team, they propose implementing a new Scheduler class, which will run at regular intervals. This Scheduler class will be designed to monitor the status of the "CS_SurveyStatusBatch" job. If the job remains in a Holding status for more than 2 consecutive intervals, the system will trigger an immediate notification.

Title: UPgrade to MSAL to MSAL2.0+
Description:
Per Stay Current guidelines and community discussed changes in Chromium (backend for MS Edge and Google Chrome browsers) All apps need to update MSAL to use Authorization Code flow for the authentication process.

On advice and working with MS, ESO team revised the way the MSAL usage report is generated.  As a result some additional apps were added to the list.

Please note: some apps using Java which is MSAL version 1 for Java may inadvertently be picked up as out of compliance. The key is to certify your app is using Authorization Code Flow authentication.

Chromium is expected to make updates to the code base by Jun 2024.  These updates are expected to cause issues with any app using Implicit Flow authentication. Both MS Edge and Google Chrome use Chormium in the back end.

Action Required Complete based on team provided dates

  • 1) Decommission app or update to Authorization Code Flow
    2) Remove any references to older versions of MSAL
    3) Implement Authorization Code Flow - CR ESO Config to MSAL
    4) ADAL to MSAL Migration | Access Management (accenture.com) - useful info for MSAL to MSAL
  • For ESO assistance: IAM.AM.ApplicationIntegration@accenture.com. Many ESO resources are based in Philippines.
Acceptance Criteria:
Reference Link: Team View - CIO Now (accenture.com)

User Story 691174: MVP 14 Managing to Stay Current priorities and compliance items

Title: UPgrade ADAL to MSAL 2.0+
Description:
Per Stay Current guidelines and end of life support including security fixes for Azure Active Directory Authentication Library (ADAL) support.  All apps using ADAL need to update to MSAL 2.0+ and use Authentication Code flow for the authentication process.

All MS support and development for ADAL, including security fixes, ended on Dec 31, 2022.

This metric is in the process of being transferred to CIONow Compliance.  Security and MS are working together to identify apps which may be using ADAL legacy code in addition to ADAL token for authentication.  ADAL Legacy code may exist separately from security protocol retrieving token for Accenture network authentication.  This future report may contain apps previously listed as complete with ADAL update.

Action Required Complete based on team provided dates

  • Decommission app or upgrade app to use Authorization Code Flow
    • If you upgrade to use Authorization Code Flow
      • ADAL to MSAL Migration | Access Management (accenture.com)
      • CR ESO Config from OAuth to MSAL
      • Use Authorization Code Flow
      • Upgrading from ADAL to MSAL may require updating app components, e.g. Angular 8 or below will not work with MSAL 2.0
      • MS offers a document on migrating app to MSAL here
      • MS document overview on moving apps to the MSGraph at this page
    • For ESO assistance: IAM.AM.ApplicationIntegration@accenture.com. Many ESO resources are based in Philippines.
Acceptance Criteria:
Reference Link: Team View - CIO Now (accenture.com)

User Story 691174: MVP 14 Managing to Stay Current priorities and compliance items

Title: [TEST] EPS - Supplier - Logic for Buy Details at Project Interaction level - Cont.
Description:
Things to consider
  • Once the user adds a new SI, these details are overwritten by the details in the SI only when field “Plan A/B” has as a value: “Plan A – Preferred Supplier”
  • If a Supplier Interaction is deleted, the aggregated details are modified as appropriate 
  • The field “How dependent are we on these Suppliers or Partners” is always overwritten with the value from the last SI the user added.
  • Estimated Supplier Cost (USD, M) is the sum of all the values from the same field at SI level, for Plan A suppliers.
  • Estimated Number of Supplier or partners is a counter which sums up the SI related to Plan A suppliers.
  • Complexity score is the only field value that changes when adding a Plan B supplier initially.
Acceptance Criteria: As part of EPS Supplier team, we would like to add a new Buy Details section at Supplier Interaction layout.

Title: [TEST] [SEC] MyAccess Integration User is removing users from the "Wave Security - Relationship" Public Group.
Description:
This User Story was created to track the issue related to My Access Team removing people from internal Public Groups - "Wave Security - Relationship". This group shouldn't be modified by anyone but MMS Security Team, who's in charge of managing this PG. 

From what be talked with MyAccess Team, these removals were part of a "Leaver Process". What this means is, when a user is terminated (former employee) they will try to remove all entitlements associated with the user.

Nevertheless, there's a user that's been removed from the Public Group and is still active: 

  • jacqui.walford

We already discussed this with MyAccess Team and they're currently investigating this particular case.
Acceptance Criteria: Related to INC42932848 - Issue with Public Group - Wave Security - Relationships

Title: [ON HOLD][SOD] - Opportunity - Make opportunity export compliance tracking fields visible to Client Team Profile
Description:
The following fields from the Opportunity Export Compliance object (OpportunityExportCompliance__c) should become read only for the MMS Client Team Profile

1.Activities/client operates rename TF (ActivitiesOrClientOperatesRename__c​)

2.Client operates in industries TF (ClientOperatesInIndustries__c)

3.Opp involve the export or transfer TF (OppInvolveExportOrTransfer__c)

4.Anything else related to trade laws TF (OppInvolveExportOrTransfer__c)

Selling Country/Location (SellingCountryOrLocation__c)

Primary Work Location (PrimaryWorkLocation__c)

Other Work Locations (OtherWorkLocations__c)

Delivery Center (DeliveryCenter__c)

CR Selling Country/Location (CRSellingCountryOrLocation__c)

 

Steps:

  1. Go to Setup
  2. Search Profiles
  3. Navigate to MMS Client Team Profile and click on it.
  4. Click on Object Settings
  5. Click on Opportunity Export Compliance under the object name column
  6. Click on Edit
  7. Tick the Checkboxes under the read access column for these fields:

    1.Activities/client operates rename TF (ActivitiesOrClientOperatesRename__c​)

    2.Client operates in industries TF (ClientOperatesInIndustries__c)

    3.Opp involve the export or transfer TF (OppInvolveExportOrTransfer__c)

    4. Anything else related to trade laws TF (OppInvolveExportOrTransfer__c)

    5. Selling Country/Location (SellingCountryOrLocation__c)

    6. Primary Work Location (PrimaryWorkLocation__c)

    7. Other Work Locations (OtherWorkLocations__c)

    8. Delivery Center (DeliveryCenter__c)

    9. CR Selling Country/Location (CRSellingCountryOrLocation__c)


  8. Click on save.
Acceptance Criteria: MMS Client Team Profile is able to see the fields listed in the description.

Title: MMP Redshift interface: Decommission | New daily process schedule
Description:
As an APM, I want to change the time that we are taking data from the MMP datasets, to align with the new ingest model.

​The idea is to use the same kind of data load, meaning, the last submitted version from MMP to MMS and day-by-day increment with the new ones and if we have a new version for the same opportunity and sub service group we should take the last one and dismiss the previous version.

Change:

Bring the MMP data at the same time when SalesODS starts their daily process 6 P.M. CST, so our new windows to take the data should be :

From the previous day at 6 P.M. to the current day at 5:59 P.M.
Monday execution exception: From Saturday at 6 P.M. to Monday at 5:59 P.M.


To complete this goal, we need to create some temporary tables to bring only the data that we will take in the new window execution. --> TBD
Acceptance Criteria: TBD

Title: Include Category Level IDs and Name Fields to Forecast Version By Planning Element in Insights.

The idea is to include extra columns at the end of the table like we did a few months ago with the Forecast Version By MME Category, so users don't have to filter by text fields in the "major" field for instance, and they don't have to select from a list of individual categoryID values either.

The enhancement is still to be refined further, but it would imply new columns in the prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.mme_2613_tm_5066_raw.stg_categoryhierarchy_planning table so we mimic what we did for prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.mme_2613_tm_5066_raw.stg_categoryhierarchy_mme, but in planning.

The new columns should be also surfaced in the SEA "copy" of the FV By Planning table: prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.sea_mmefinkpi_204066_in.sea_mme_forecastversionbyplanningelement_in

Title: Data Retention Policy - Upload list of Contracts, WBS Elements and Forecast Versions
Description:
As part of the compliance to Data Retention Policies we need to delete contracts that have been closed for over 10 years in the general MME program.

MME already run the deletion between December and March and now we need to run a deletion over the data available in the MME Lake.

The list of contracts and associated WBS elements and Forecast Versions that need to be deleted from our data has already been analyzed from MME data and is listed in the three attachments.

In this PBI we will simply create the three tables that hold those Contracts, WBS elements and Forecast Versions so Diego can continue the analysis on the data that needs to be removed from the different GCP datasets.

Proposed names for the three tables is:
  • prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.mme_2613_tm_5066_raw.data_retention_contract
  • prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.mme_2613_tm_5066_raw.data_retention_wbs
  • prd-65343-datalake-bd-88394358.mme_2613_tm_5066_raw.data_retention_fv
Note: the contracts and wbs elements are 100% defined already, but there is a possibility that the list of Forecast Versions to be deleted from our tables grows as archiving of old forecast versions was already done in MME at the time of them applying data retention and we may have a bigger number of forecast versions associated to those contracts available in our Insights Zone. That will be requested, after more analysis is complete, as part of a different PBI.
Acceptance Criteria: Three new tables, which can be joined with our existing datasets in the MME Lake to further analyze data to be deleted as part of Data Retention Policies, are created in our production environment.

Title: Update SEA Datasets production to be able to re-process old periods - Revenue Assignment Trend
Description:
When we took over the code for the Self Enabled Analytics datasets, we realized that their current code does not offer the possibility of re-processing anything but the very last production period. 

This is a problem as the expectation is that as we get more clients, they will find Bugs that required us fixing data for older periods. Ideally, we would like to have the possibility to re-process those older periods because we will not always have the chance to fix existing data (like for instance when we had the issue with missing TBD resources in the Resource Trend table because of a badly implemented filter in the Country field looking for Germany).

The ideal solution would let us enter the period to be re-processed as a parameter, also allowing us to leave it blank in case we want to go for a standard production.

We also have the requirement to support the possibility of re-processing all data in the SEA tables. So, alternatively, we could simply have an additional  parameter that forces reprocessing of ALL periods, or two parameters instead of the one proposed above, so we have a "startPeriod" and an "endPeriod" couple of parameters.

The final decision on how to implement both requirements should come at the time you are doing technical design:
  • One paramenter with the period to re-process and we simply call the process several times if we have to re-process the entire table.
  • Two parameters with the StartPeriod and the EndPeriod to re-process (they could point to the same period if it is just one period to be re-processed).
  • One parameter with the period to re-process plus one additional parameter with a "ProcessALL" flag, which ignores the first parameter and simply reprocess all periods in the table.
Acceptance Criteria: The production of the SEA table can accept parameters (or looks for a table or server variables) the indicate the period or periods to be re-processed.

Title: [TEST] LinkedIn Sales Navigator - SCIM Intro
Description:
Steps to test:
  1. Assign a user to the AAD group.
  2. Wait for ~30 minutes for SCIM to do the license assignment.
  3. Verify the license is assigned.
  4. Remove a user from the AAD group.
  5. Wait for ~30 minutes for SCIM to revoke the license.
  6. Verify the license is revoked.
Note: Sagar and Agustin from the EM team can help us add or remove users from the AAD group.
Acceptance Criteria: If a user is added or removed from the group it automatically will be assigned or unassigned to a LinkedIn Sales Navigator license.

Title: NB Coach Cards Creation - Prompt Responses
Description:
As a UI designer I want the user to have the option to edit a generated response to a question so that they don’t have to write a response on their own which will save them time.

 

As a UI designer I want the User to select a Prompt response so that a generated response with the ability to edit shows in the input field in the chat.
Acceptance Criteria:
FIGMA LINK: https://www.figma.com/file/G2SpopNam3KwGV1f6YrvT3/Virtual-Approver-PoC-1%3A-Chat-Bot?type=design&mode=design&t=rVICjd1qjBZ84nCd-0 

 

  • Above the input field we will provide Prompt options
  • When the prompt is selected a generated response with ability to edit is displayed in the open chat field.

Title: UI — User Feedback Survey - system Prompt
Description: As a UI Designer, I want users to be asked to provide feedback via a survey link when the user exits or closes out of their session.
Acceptance Criteria: 1. When the user tries to exit or close out of the chatbot a system generated prompt appears for them to take a survey with the option to dismiss and not provide feedback.

Title: [ANG] NBC- Creation of Digital NBM Place holder for the Bot Summary on Overview Page
Description:
Requirements Section

This product would act as a coach and assistant for the approver during the NBM, providing insights, questions, and suggestions based on data and analytics. It would also provide a view on the strengths and weaknesses of the deal. The future of the product would act as a virtual approver that can ask and answer questions, pull data and insights, and provide a go forward strategy for deals that would otherwise go to an NBM.
Acceptance Criteria: It will be feasible to support the UI components and functionality wise, if GenAI Chatbot client app components are embedded into MMS end.

Title: Process recordings into Transcripts
Description: As a Developer I need NBMs transcribed so that I can process the transcripts to extract questions and answers
Acceptance Criteria: • Transcripts recorded and shared in restricted teams channel

Title: Update Criteria for Strengths and Weaknesses Identified Through Workshop
Description: As a data scientist, I would like to update the criteria to identify strong / neutral / weak responses to questions so that I can collect strong, weak answers for the deal summary. We will need SME input on creating examples to score as well.
Acceptance Criteria: • Function: apply examples of strong and weak for a given question and return the answer

Title: UI — User Input Field
Description: As a UI Designer, I want users to have a text input field with which they can send messages to the chat bot, including basic instructions on how to use it as well as a disclaimer and link to our privacy policy.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Placeholder text should exist when the user is not engaging with the input field

  • When a user clicks into the input field the placeholder text should disappear

  • When a user types in the input field the text formatting appears differently than the placeholder text (see Figma)

  • The disclaimer should be present under the input field at all times. This text will be static.

  • A link to the Privacy Policy should be present at all times below the text input field, which will open the privacy policy in a new browser tab (https://in.accenture.com/protectingaccenture/5422-2/)

  • User can submit their text by pressing Enter/Return or by pressing the send icon. Pressing Shift+Enter will allow the user to add a new line in the text box. Instructions for these action should be present under the text input field

  • Input field should scale vertically to a height capable of displaying a maximum of 3 lines of text (See "User Text Input Field" component in Figma)

  • If more than 3 lines of text are entered the user will be able to scroll up/down within the text input field. This does not require a visible scroll bar. (See "MVP1 - Sidebar Open - Very Long Response Example" and "User Text Input Field" component in Figma)
  • When the text input field gets taller (2 or more lines of text entered) the conversation chat bubble container should scale vertically so that it does not overlap the prompts or input field. (See "MVP1 - Sidebar Open - Long Response Example" in Figma)

Title: [SF] NBC- Creation of the field to store the Bot Summary - hold on
Description:
Requirements Section

This product would act as a coach and assistant for the approver during the NBM, providing insights, questions, and suggestions based on data and analytics. It would also provide a view on the strengths and weaknesses of the deal. The future of the product would act as a virtual approver that can ask and answer questions, pull data and insights, and provide a go forward strategy for deals that would otherwise go to an NBM.
Acceptance Criteria: It will be feasible to support the UI components and functionality wise, if GenAI Chatbot client app components are embedded into MMS end.

Title: [SF] NBC- Scope of Bot Functionality: which questions the bot can answer, what bot will write back
Description: Embedding Bot UI in MMS, Real time integration of Bot and MMS.
Acceptance Criteria: It will be feasible to support the UI components and functionality wise, if GenAI Chatbot client app components are embedded into MMS end.

Title: Create hierarchy of Questions and Evaluation criteria for weak and strong for those questions
Description:
As a sales manager, I want to create a hierarchy of questions and evaluation criteria for deal qualification, winnability, desirability, and deliverability so that I can better understand the potential success of a deal
 and make informed decisions about which deals to pursue.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. The hierarchy of questions should be created in a logical and organized manner, with each level building upon the previous one.
2. The questions should be specific and relevant to the deal qualification, winnability, desirability, and deliverability of the potential deals.
3. The evaluation criteria for each question should be clear and concise, with specific guidelines for what constitutes a weak or strong response.
4. The evaluation criteria should be based on measurable factors, such as budget, timeline, stakeholder buy-in, and competition.
5. The hierarchy of questions and evaluation criteria should be easily editable and updatable as the sales landscape changes over time.
6. The hierarchy of questions and evaluation criteria should be easily accessible to all members of the sales team for reference and use in deal analysis and decision-making.

Title: Detail out the common Win / Loss Analysis that Trisha's Team does
Description: As a data scientist, I want to detail out the types of opportunity win loss analysis that is typically done, so that users better understand the reasons behind why ACN is winning or losing deals, and identify areas to focus on for my deal.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Design of analysis should identify any common trends or patterns among the deals
- Design analysis should include a comparison of the company's win/loss rates over time
- Design analysis should be presented in a clear and concise manner, with visual aids as needed

Title: Generate summary of weakness areas to discuss for improvement or addressing
Description:
As a data scientist, I can input the question ontology and criteria, and the genAI
Azure function will analyze each answer to identify any potential opportunity weaknesses or areas that require improvement so that those weaknesses can be highlighted for further improvement.
Acceptance Criteria:
- The tool should user answers to the question ontology.
- The tool should generate a summary of opportunity weak areas.
- The summary should be easy to understand and use.
- The tool should be accurate in providing list of weaknesses

Title: Run NBM Recordings through Batch Transcription
Description: Create Transcriptions for exisiting NBM files for US
Acceptance Criteria: • Transcripts are complete and provided in a controlled teams folder

Title: Rank the strength of those answers from 0 weak to 4 strong
Description:
User Story:
As a data analyst, I want to use a combination of hand labeling and genAI to score answers from 0 to 4 for question-answer pairs extracted from NBM transcripts, 
so that I can analyze the transcripts efficiently and accurately.
Acceptance Criteria:
- The script should extract question-answer pairs from the NBM transcripts accurately.
- The script should allow the user to hand label the answers as 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4.
- The genAI algorithm should generate scores for the answers based on the hand-labeled data with an accuracy rate of at least 60%.
- The script should be able to handle datasets of ~200 question-answer pairs without crashing or slowing down.
- The final scores generated by the system should be writtento a spreadsheet or other data format and summarized.

Title: NB Coach Cards Creation - Approver View -  Strengths & Weakness + Discussion Topics
Description: As a UI designer I want the Approvers to be able to review the generated Strengths and Weakness Summary and recommended discussion topics for an opportunity so that they have context on what to address during a New Business Meeting.
Acceptance Criteria:
FIGMA LINK: To be Provided

 

  • Strengths and weaknesses will be displayed without side panel and chat functionality only when approvers link to the page via New Business Management tool
  • Discussion Topics will be displayed without side panel and chat functionality only when approvers link to the page via New Business Management tool
  • Strengths and weaknesses and Discussion Topics will be centered in the screen with the ability to scale appropriately across Desktop resolutions
  • Strengths and weaknesses and Discussion Topics will be view only test when accessed by Approvers
  • Approver will be able to view top navigation bar that will include Opportunity ID and Master Client name with Notification call out will need to be updated to say '"NOTE: The information displayed below was generated by AI as part of the New Business Coach pilot program."  ( Language needs to be approved by Kelly - will get 2/22 )

Title: NB Coach Cards Creation - Strategy Summary - Right slide out Panel

As a UI designer I want the User to be able to toggle between their Insights and Strategy Summary generated by the AI chatbot conversation.

 

As a UI designer I want the user to review key details around their Pricing & Negotiation, Relationship, Competitive, and Solution Strategy generated by the chatbot so that the user can prepare for approval discussion and New Business Management meetings.


As a UI designer I want the user to be able to edit inline and copy to clip board the generated content so that they can refine and copy as they need.  
As a UI designer I want the user to be notified of syncing status to MMS so that they know what data has been ingested and when.

  • All content areas have the ability to Edit inline and Copy to user clipboard:
    • Client Context
    • Business Problem
    • Opportunity Details
    • Competitive & Strategy
    • Key Roles
    • Discussion Objectives
    • Strategy Overview
    • Risks and Challneges
    • Key Buyers and Values
    • Financials ( Total Value  + Follow on )
    • What needs to be true to win
  • Sync content back to appropriate MMS 5 Strategy Fields @Anju Anju Create and link card that outlines where within MMS data will be injected
  • notification: Sync status for content areas in strategy to notify users when MMS has been updated.

As a UI designer I would like the user to be able to easily search for an oppty ID so that that can prepare the strategy with the chatbot.

  • The Oppty Name and Master client name will need to be fixed to the left of the navigation bar and data will be pulled from MMS - Opportunity ID API and Query MMS to get attributes @Anju Anju will need to be linked to all attributes for the app coming from MMS.
  • Yellow Notification Note will be constant in the top bar
  • Search field will allow users to bring up opportunities from MMS with smart search capabilities i.e autocomplete  @Anju Anju will need to be linked to all attributes for the app coming from MMS.

Title: NB Coach Cards Creation - Insights Content - Right slide out Panel
Description:
As a UI designer I want the User to be able to toggle between their Insights and Strategy Summary generated by the AI chatbot conversation.

 

As a UI designer I want the user to review their deal summary, action items and next steps, Top 3 Reasons We Win/lose, Competitor Insights, Similar deal insights and Industry Success Stories so that they can strengthen their opportunity and review data provided by the chatbot conversation.

 

As a UI designer I want the user to be able to copy the Deal Summary and Action Items & Next steps so they can paste it easily.

FIGMA LINK: https://www.figma.com/file/G2SpopNam3KwGV1f6YrvT3/Virtual-Approver-PoC-1%3A-Chat-Bot?type=design&mode=design&t=rVICjd1qjBZ84nCd-0 

 

  • Deal Summary and Actions and next steps content with ability to copy to user clipboard
  • Action items and next steps recommended by the bot based on strengths and weaknesses data @Anju Anju Will need a card to focus on where this data is coming from. 
  • Top 3 reasons We Win pulls in Win/Loss insights @Anju Anju Will need to align and point to where API will come from
  • Competitive Insights @Anju Anju Will need to align and point to where API will come from
  • Similar Deal insights includes Title of deal with a contact email  @Anju Anju Will need to align and point to where MMS pull sales capture lead info and need to set email subject to oppty ID/name for similar deal in HTML link. We are NOT going to store this information. We will just read it in real time from the opportunity.
  • Industry Success Stories Story title and Industry with link to story -  @Anju Anju Will need to link to API @Jim Mataway link to his story.

Title: NB Coach Cards Creation - Commit User permissions to write back to MMS
Description:
As a UI designer I want the user to review the right side panel content and check the check box agreeing with the content generated by that AI so that the data ingested in MMS is accurate and true to what the user wants.

 

As a UI designer I want the User to Click the 'Update Strategy in MMS' button so that he generated strategy is ingested into MMS strategy sections.

FIGMA LINK: https://www.figma.com/file/G2SpopNam3KwGV1f6YrvT3/Virtual-Approver-PoC-1%3A-Chat-Bot?type=design&mode=design&t=rVICjd1qjBZ84nCd-0

Title: [EM] [Offcycle] Opportunity - Scheduling WPP Model reference to old Dec'23 release user story - Copy
Description:
With the previous user story wrt Opportunity - Retraining and Refreshing the WPP Model (https://dev.azure.com/accenturecio20/SELL_PR1011/_workitems/edit/350934)

some of the model refresh setting options were not enabled(which we realized is not allowing backend data integration on regular intervals)

resulting in no-updates to real time scores with field changes as implemented by users.

 

Hence it would be great to add a child reference to the old user story and re-deploy the model in production off cycle with immediate effect-

 

Business Criticality- Users can’t see updated scores since the model doesn’t allow data from all objects to integrate without recipe refresh and scheduler (Please find the email attached)

 

List of tasks to be involved:

1) Proposed Name of reference user story- ‘Scheduling WPP Model reference to old user story’

2) One time Recipe(re-run) + model refresh then opt in for auto schedule (To allow latest data integration of all related Objects i.e Opportunity+ Supplement objects immediately and going forward)

3) Weekly auto schedule job (could be every Tuesday off time)

 

 

Recipes to be refreshed and auto scheduled:

  • Trial_Additional_WPP_Variable
  • GreaterThan5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipleline_Prod_Q124
  • GT5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipleline_ALL_OPPS_Q124
  • LT5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipeline_Prod_Q124
  • LT5M_Marketting_Additional_Pipeline_All_OPPS_Q124

 

Model Name to be refreshed and auto scheduled:

WPP_Model_MM (IsWon_GRT5M_MM and IsWon_LT5M_MM)
Acceptance Criteria: The data through supplement object to sink in after recipe refresh and 1st auto-schedule.

Title: Workshop Feedback and Prioritization of Questions (Deal assessment)

Title: [ON HOLD] [TEST] Contact 360 - Updates to Photos
Description:
In Contact 360, the Name/Info tile and the Relationship Owner tile are not displaying photos.  

As a contact administrator, I want to display a user icon for broken images in the Contact360 Name/Info tile and Relationship Owner tile, so that error messages or broken images will not be displayed.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. Name/Info tile:
    1. If the LinkedIn Image field contains an invalid link, no broken image should be displayed on the Name/Info tile.  
    2. If the LinkedIn Image field is blank, the Name/info tile will not display any photo, but no errors should be shown.
  2. Relationship Owner tile:
    1. As the people pages are decommissioned, the Primary/Secondary owner in Relationship Owner tile should not display any photo. There should be no broken image and no errors should be displayed. Only the user icon should be shown.

Title: [SF] Opportunity - Sales team - Addition of new Alliance Partner(s) field for Alliance Market Development Director role
Description:
Changes requested:

  1. Sales Team Approved Users List
    • For the Alliance Market Development Director role, we request a new field in the Sales Team Approved Users that will indicate the Alliance Partner(s) which the Alliance Market Development Director is associated.  This new field only applies to the Alliance Market Development Director Sales Team role.
    • If an Alliance Market Development Director is associated with more than 1 Alliance Partner, we need to be able to add each of his/her Alliance Partners.  Ideally we would be able to list multiple Alliance Partners under an Alliance Market Development Director rather than have to enter the same Alliance Market Development Director multiple times.
    • The list of valid Alliance Partners will need to be tied to the existing Alliances attribute picklist values.  
  1. Sales Team
  • We are requesting an additional level of detail in the Sales Team for the Alliance Market Development Director role field. The intent is to have 1 Alliance Market Development Director role for each of the Alliances associated with the Opportunity (based on the Alliance attributes on the opp). Each Alliance Market Development Director role for each Alliance Partner would have 100% allocation available. For example, if an Opportunity has Alliance attributes coded Workday 50% and AWS 50%, the Sales Team will have a role for Alliance Market Development Director for AWS (with an allocation of 100% that can be used for 1 or more MDDs within the same Partner) and an Alliance Market Development Director role for Workday with a 100% allocation associated with it too.  There should not be an Alliance Market Development Director role for the portion of the opp in which the Alliances attribute is “Not Applicable”. 
  • The Alliance Market Development Director will only be able to be added to the Alliance Market Development Director role associated with their corresponding Alliance Partner based on the Alliance Partner(s) to which they are associated within the Sales Team Approved Users list.
  • From a user experience perspective, we would like to explore whether it would be best to have the MDD role in its own tab on the Sales Team or keep it where it currently is located

Title: [TEST] Lookbook Intake Form - Implementation
Description:
As a Lookbook Intake Form administrator we need to build a functionality in MMS so users can requests Lookbooks about one or more Contacts:
-The lookbook will be linked to an account.
-We need to generate a questionnaire with questions like these:
  • This lookbook was requested by a GMC member.
  • This request is related to a priority account.
  • This request is related to an open opportunity
  • This lookbook will be used for account planning
  • This lookbook will be used for landing an origination idea’
-You can use a Mult picklist field for the questionnaire
-Depending on the checked option(s), you must check if the account selected in the first step is a priority account (you can get it with the Priority Account MU(s) or Priority Account Service(s) fields in the account object).
Priority account:
-If you select a priority account, you will need to select an opportunity related to this account. When you select the opportunity, you will need to add the buyer's key contacts related to this opportunity.  
To know if a contact is a key buyer, it is obtained from the object 'key buyer' and that the opportunity is the one related above, from there you get the field 'KeyBuyerId__c' that refers to the contact.
-You should also check to see if a Account planning or origination account exists, if so, just select the contacts associated with the account. If not, select the opportunity and the key buyer contacts for that opportunity.
No Priority account:
-It should be related to an Opportunity. But you will need to get the fields of that opportunity and compare if the 'MegaDeal__c' field is 'Mega' or 'Not Mega'.
If the 'MegaDeal' field of the opportunity object has the value 'Mega', request the key buyer contacts associated with the opportunity.
If the "MegaDeal" field of the opportunity object has value "Not Mega", a message is displayed indicating that the lookbook must be created manually.

Important considerations:
  • If you select an opportunity, the contacts that will be selected will be key buyers only.
  • If you do not select an opportunity, the contacts that will be selected will be related to the account.
  • Another object is needed to be the link between the contacts called 'Contact/Book Relationship'.
  • Fields we need:
    • For the lookbook:
      • Type of picklist named "Initiative" to be completed manually by the ci team.
      • Type of picklist named "Type of assistance" to be completed manually by the ci team.
      • Text type, named 'Comments'.
      • Date type, named 'Delivery date.
      • Type of formula to indicate the stage of the opportunity.
    • For the Contact/Lookbook relationship:
      • Master detail for a contact.
      • A checkbox named 'Are you a key buyer?
      • A master detail field to get the lookbook.
      • A lookup field to get the key buyer.

Title: [SF] Lookbook Intake Form – Case Management (Client Insight Team)
Description: As Client Insight Team I want to find an automate way to enable Manage MySales users to request so that improve the current process that is supported via email and monitored manually using Excel

Title: [SF] Lookbook Intake Form – ‘Request a lookbook intake form’
Description: As Lookbook requestor I want to log my request in Manage MySales so that I get opportunities, accounts, contacts data to generate my request and see the status of it.
Acceptance Criteria:
• The saved request is visible in the case object(Private). 

  • Select Account, Opportunity(not mandatory) and contacts in the request based on the decision tree.  

  • Requests created always need to be related to an existing account in MMS and all executives need to be added to MMS as contacts. 

  • If the request created is related to an Account but NOT an Opportunity, you should be able to add contacts related to the Account.  

  • If the request created is related to an Account and an Opportunity, you should be able to add key buyer contacts related to the Opportunity. 

  • The request has been related to Contacts (we can store it in a junction object called 'Contact/Case Relationship'). 

  • Select 1 or more contacts in one request.  

  • Account, Opportunity, and Contacts related to the request automatically stored in the case object. 

  • Questions and answers related to the questionnaire should be automatically stored in the case object. 

  • The ‘status of the request’ at the time of saving is "new". 

  • The user can only see the request created by themselves.

Title: DATA WAREHOUSE: Decomize CH tables and their dependencies (Jobs and Stored Procedures)
Description:
As an APM I want to decomize CH tables and their dependecies and Job in SalesDW.

Tables:

Rename with _Decomize at the end: (Step 2)

[2766_SalesMgmtRptg_Public].[CH].CustomerAttributeCd
[2766_SalesMgmtRptg_Public].[CH].CustomerRelationshipAttribute
[2766_SalesMgmtRptg_Public].[CH].CustomerAttribute
[2766_SalesMgmtRptg_Public].[CH].Customer
[2766_SalesMgmtRptg_Public].[CH].CustomerRelationship
[2766_SalesDW].[DW].DimCustomerAttributeCd
[2766_SalesDW].[DW].DimCustomerAttribute --> We are using it in the DWAccess.CustomerRelationshipHierarchy_vw

Control M: (Step 1)

Set as Dummy the following Jobs: (On Dummy (MJD))

MRD-EBI-SMR-001-B-MAINBOX-000 MRD-EBI-SRM-001-C-CUSATCD-001 MRDR [CH].CustomerAttributeCd
MRD-EBI-SRM-001-C-CUSREAT-001 MRDR [CH].CustomerRelationshipAttribute
MRD-EBI-SRM-001-C-CUSTATR-001 MRDR [CH].CustomerAttribute
MRD-EBI-SRM-001-C-CUSTOMR-001 MRDR [CH].Customer
MRD-EBI-SRM-001-C-CUSTREL-001 MRDR [CH].CustomerRelationship

Metadata: (Step 3)
Inactivate from the metadata the DW.DimCustomerAttributeCd table.
Table Mapping 54

Remember when updating, place audit trails.

Update ETL.TableMappingMetadata
set ActiveInd = 'N',
UpdateUserId = SYSTEM_USER,
UpdateDttm = GETDATE()
Where TableMappingId = 54

Stored Procedures: (Step 4)
Rename with _Decomize at the end
Private Database:
[SPP].[SPE_GDPR_MasterClientList]
Acceptance Criteria:
1- When I open public database, I see that CH and DimCustomerAttributeCd tables are renamed with the subfix _Decomize.
2- Check the jobs related to CH are set to dummy.
3- Check the metadata of the DW.DimCustomerAttributeCd table is inactivated.
4- Check [SPP].[SPE_GDPR_MasterClientList] sp is renamed with the subfix _Decomize.

Title: [CR] [TEST] Opportunity - Changing the logic of SC Deviation Amount field
Description:
As a part of this CR, we need to do the below changes in the SC Deviation Amount field calculation logic:

Existing Logic: If value in Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null",  then the calculation of SC Deviation Amount doesn't happen.
New Logic: If value in the Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null", then it would proceed with calculation, considering "Capital Charge = 0".
Acceptance Criteria: The SC Deviation Amount field should get calculated, even if value in Capital Charge = Blank/Null

Title: [CR] [SF] Opportunity - Changing the logic of SC Deviation Amount field
Description:
As a part of this CR, we need to do the below changes in the SC Deviation Amount field calculation logic:

Existing Logic: If value in Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null",  then the calculation of SC Deviation Amount doesn't happen.
New Logic: If value in the Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null", then it would proceed with calculation, considering "Capital Charge = 0".

Also we need to update the logic while calculating "Total SC%" -

Existing Logic: If value in Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null",  then the calculation of Total SC% doesn't happen.
New Logic: If value in the Capital Charge field is "Blank/Null", then it would proceed with calculation, considering "Capital Charge = 0".
Acceptance Criteria: The SC Deviation Amount field should get calculated, even if value in Capital Charge = Blank/Null
