Title: [FA] Creation Action Page: Create and Track an Action
Description:
Action tracking is a new functionality we are introducing that builds on the current close the loop functionality. Currently, business stakeholders receive a notification (nudge) that they have client feedback waiting for them in Discover. This feedback could be something that is lengthy/verbose/extremely positive/extremely negative. The next step is for the user to click on the nudge and review that feedback. Once the feedback is viewed, the stakeholders do not have a way to track next steps/any actions on this feedback, that is where this feature comes into play. This feature allows stakeholders to review client feedback, create a follow up action, and then track that follow up action. 

This functionality will be using Qualtrics' ticketing / action planning module. 


This story covers the pages that allow for a follow up action to be created and then for that action to be tracked on the myACT dashboard. This button should lead to another page that allows users to enter in details for their task and save. 

Once the task is saved, it should be come up on the list of tasks associated with that Master Account.  


"As a User, I want to be able to create an Action and link it to a CX Plan automatically. I should be able to assign it to my self or to my team members/delegates, so we can track and work on it.

Additional Info:
Form Fields - to be confirmed"


Add in something to go back/exit out of this 

POC:
Acceptance Criteria:
Button on myACT page that links to a new Action Page
Create New Action page with the following entries/text boxes: 
  • Plan Name
  • Description 
  • Due Date
  • Owner
Save button/Create task 

Task should save and should be associated with the Master Client and should be shown in the full task list.

Title: Send data from Data Cloud to MMS sandbox
Description: As a part of the ongoing Data Cloud POC we are need to prove out how we can extract data from the Data Cloud back to our MMS Sales Cloud for this we need an Integration resource that will be able to help set up one of our MMS Sandboxes to recieve data events from the data cloud.

Title: Contacts - Only allow Key Buyers to be added to opp if Primary Relationship Owner is active
Description:
As Sales Excellence team I want only allow Key Buyers to be added to opp if Primary Relationship Owner is active so that contacts data is keep updated.
Flow:
  • Opportunity user clicks on New Key Buyer
  • User select a Contact that the Primary Relationship Owner is Inactive (MMS User Status field)
  • Error message should be displayed. Wording TBD. Due to Power Maps we need to add this validation in apex so we can display which record is failing. Similar to: ("The Key Buyer, Kevin Masuda (Chief Executive Officer), is missing an "Accenture Relationship Strength" value. Please complete the information on their Contact record before adding to the opportunity.") User Story 282016: [SF] Opp - Creation of a New Validation on the Key Buyer creation page - Part 1
  • ​This validation needs to be skipped by Sys Admin to prevent errors in conversions
Open Point: 
If the PRO becomes inactive, what is going to happen with the existing Key Buyers records (this scenario could drive in potential issues in editions, conversions….) or are we going to add the validation only during the creation of the Key Buyer?

Note:  we cannot add more filters based on Contacts object due to we have reached out the limit

  • FYI: @Punchak, Brian T. @Priya Khedekar
Acceptance Criteria: Only allow Key Buyers to be added to opp if Primary Relationship Owner is active

[TEST] Opportunity - Checkout Page - changes in Submit to Stage Indicator
Description:
Adding this Submit to Stage Indicator requirement the following scenarios that weren't covered in the original User story 161394

  • Opportunity reopens, if the conditions Below are met:
Stage(StageName): any Closed stage
Approval status(OM_R1_Approval_status__c): contains pending
Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c): contains any active stage

Then in the indicator bar the stages that are before the value in Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c) should be green, the stage's value in Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c)  field should be blue and all the stages after this, grey, except for the closed stage which should be green, see example below:
    • Stage(StageName) = Closed – Won
    • Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c) = 2B 
    • Approval status(OM_R1_Approval_status__c): Pending Approval
    • 0, 1, 2A, Closed stage should be displayed in green
    • 2B stage should be displayed in blue
    • Every other stage after the Submit to Stage should be displayed in grey (See screenshot below for reference)

       
  • Example for an opportunity moving backwards:
    • Stage(StageName) = 3C
    • Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c) = 2A
    • Approval status(OM_R1_Approval_status__c): Pending Approval
    • 0, 1 stage should be displayed in green
    • 2A stage should be displayed in blue
    • Every other stage after the Submit to Stage should be displayed in grey (except for 3C), see screenshot below:

    • Once the deal is approved to Stage 2A, Stage 3C should be displayed in grey and 2A in green.

  • Hover text reflecting the Stages field should be displayed:

When a user hovers the cursor over any section of the submit to stage indicator a hover text should come up reflecting the values of the following fields from the opportunity object:

Stage(StageName)

Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c)

Approval status (OM_R1_Approval_status__c)

 

    • Hover text example:

Stage: 1

Submit to Stage: 3B

Approval Status: Approved Stage 1

  • Opportunity is closed without passing through all stages:
If an opportunity gets closed before passing through all the stages. 
The stages that it didn't go through should remain grey and all the other stages should be colored green, and the closed stage should reflect the value from the Stage(StageName) field, see screenshot below for reference:


  • Adding for reference the screenshot of how the indicator bar should look for a Closed - Won opportunity



Aditional notes about indicator's behavior:

  • If Stage(StageName)= to any specific closed stage (closed - won, closed - lost, etc) then the specific text should be reflected in the las chevron of the indicator and the Chevron should be green
  • If Stage(StageName)= any active stage (0, 1,2A etc) and Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c) = any active stage then the last Chevron should be grey and the text  in there should read 'Closed'
  • If Stage(StageName)= any active stage and Submit To Stage (OM_R1_Submitted_to_stage__c)= specific closed stage(closed - won, closed lost, etc) then the last Chevron should be blue and the text should reflect the specific stage (closed - won, closed lost, etc)
Acceptance Criteria: A submit to stage indicator should be at the top of the checkout page, visually reflecting the stage status of a deal.

Title: Data Cloud POC permission set creation in MMS Prod
Acceptance Criteria:
Creation of a new Permission Set for Data Cloud POC testing

This permission set will remove the access given to the data cloud raw data elements which would only allow with this permission set to see curated or transformed data and not the actual raw data.
  • Data Streams
  • Data Lake Objects

Current OOB Data Cloud permission sets provided by Salesforce provide View All Access to all data cloud objects

this has to be done directly in MMS Prod as Data Cloud is only available from Salesforce currently in our Production Instance.

Title: [DC] Opportunity - Populate value in 'Used' field of Opp Attribute Tablet Selection object
Description:
Conversion to populate value in ‘Used’ field of Opp Attribute Tablet Selection object (Data team)

The following changes must be made:

 

  • As part of conversion, populate the value in ‘Used’ field of Opp Attribute Tablet Selection object per the logic mentioned in Chapter 1.
  • Meaning, if user selects any of the Recommended Solution Tablets in the “Solution Tablets” field of ‘Solution Tablets’ tab (‘Solution Tablet and Asset Selection for Opportunity’ page), then populate “Yes” value in the ‘Used’ field of ‘Opp Attribute Tablet Selection’ object for all the recommendations lines that match, since there's usually more than one attribute suggesting a tablet (as it is Many to Many relationship).
  • Scope: All Active + FY24 Closed deals
  • Message/Trigger: OFF
Acceptance Criteria: Populate Yes/No value in ‘Used’ field of Opp Attribute Tablet Selection object based on the logic to reconnect the selections made in the new Tablet Asset transaction object to the Used field from the Opp Attribute Tablet Selection object. This will help ARC leadership on the selections made to the recommendations for reporting purposes

Title: [TEST] EPS - CPQ - Update Client and Accenture Discount % calculation to avoid error in reports.
Description:
As a Resale CPQ user, I want to update the formulas of ‘Client Discount %’ and ‘Accenture Discount %’ in Quote object ‘, so that calculation is only executed when Total List Price <> '0'.

Pre-Conditions

  1. User needs to have an active CPQ access. 
  2. Resale Quote is created.
  3. Quote has ESD and Sales Rep information.
  4. Generate/Preview document buttons are available.

Story Dependences

  • ​No.
Acceptance Criteria:
• The formulas of ‘Client Discount %’ and ‘Accenture Discount %’ in Quote object need to be updated to execute calculation only when ‘Total List Price <> '0'.
    • As a user I should not see the ‘#Error!’ messages in Financial Summary reports for those fields when Total List Price is ‘0’ and calculation cannot be performed.
Update ‘Client Discount %’ and ‘Accenture Discount %’ formula as below:

Accenture Discount %

Previous formula:
( TotalListPrice__c - PackageCostQ__c ) / TotalListPrice__c

New Formula:
IF(TotalListPrice__c = 0, NULL, ( TotalListPrice__c - PackageCostQ__c ) / TotalListPrice__c)

Client Discount %
Previous formula:

(TotalListPrice__c - SBQQ__NetAmount__c) / TotalListPrice__c

New Formula:
IF(TotalListPrice__c = 0, NULL, (TotalListPrice__c - SBQQ__NetAmount__c) / TotalListPrice__c)

Title: Surveys Not Submitting for Qualtrics End Users
Description:
Original Bug link for more details: https://dev.azure.com/accenturecio20//SELL_PR1011/_workitems/edit/318715/

 Bug 301738-  Associated Bug 

Background:
Multiple End Users Reporting that surveys they complete and submit do not submit. Business approved solution to include auto submit and animation before survey submit to prevent responses from being deleted if users exit the survey.


12/6 clarified requirements: 
  • the loading Animation should happen after the last question in both project and feedback account surveys
  • the flow is Question 8 --> spinning wheel animation --> thank you text. We no longer need to have the 'your responses' text

Here where the X is - this can be removed, we no longer need this verbiage so no translation is needed. We just need to replace it with the spinning animation and that is it.
Acceptance Criteria:
Accepted Solution:
-Include Loading Animation after the last question and before survey submission in both project and feedback account surveys.
-Include auto submit functionality in the same location (after last question and before survey submission for both surveys)
-Use the following animation on the survey (Already in Qualtrics Shared Folder (@Eldarel Solon uploaded)
https://accenture.co1.qualtrics.com/ControlPanel/Graphic.php?IM=IM_1oLMawyq14JFsM0


Business Team UAT required for positive scenario 
IPT Testing needed for negative scenario (if it gets disconnected etc.) 



12/6 clarified requirements: 
  • the loading Animation should happen after the last question in both project and feedback account surveys
  • the flow is Question 8 --> spinning wheel animation --> thank you text. We no longer need to have the 'your responses' text
  • the spinning automation should be the auto submit for the survey 

Here where the X is - this can be removed, we no longer need this verbiage so no translation is needed. We just need to replace it with the spinning animation and that is it.

Title: [TEST] Contacts - Enable Restricted Contacts - Part 2
Description:
There are Contacts in MMS that requires an additional layer of security due to legal restrictions. Different solutions where discussed (Attached) and the short-term solution is to create a private object to support those private contacts with the following functionalities:
  • Private Object 
  • Fields: required fields of Contact object
  • Activities enabled
  • Security based on a permission set and MC ATR
  • Only available at MC level
  • Duplicate Rules- Should mimic the Contact Duplicate rules (Business is aware that this will not cross over with the Contact rules so possible to have a duplicate in the contact object and same as this object)

  • Integration – Confirmed No Integration for initial release

  • One Trust - Plan to include this process with the custom object (I’ve discussed with Nacho he thinks it is doable but will be sending up follow up email to one trust cio person and Stephen)  Of note business has not confirmed this process will be necessary but want us to proceed with planning as if it will be confirmed.

This story covers chapters 5, 6, 7, 8
Acceptance Criteria:
Create a custom Private Contact object displayed in a new related list at MC level that is only accessible for limited amount of users.
These limited users will see the new related list and depending on the access they will C/R/E or D records in it. They will also see existing contacts list. Rest of users will see just the existing contacts list as today.

Title: [Descope] [SF] Integration Request for SC - Intent 4.1 Sales Team - – Unit Testing PART 1
Description:
Requirements Section

The Sales Concierge has come up with an initiative to automate the emailing process to reduce the manual efforts of Sales Ops team. As part of the intent 4 requirement for MMS Access, Sales Concierge Team is adding in scope roles on different levels (Opportunity Level). The team will be subscribing to Data Fabric to consume the Read Only and ReadWrite fields of MMS.

 

Important Notes

  • Sales Concierge will have access to all the MMS accounts under which roles that are in scope will be created
  • Account plan access and client feedback will be provided by Sales Concierge
  • Sales Concierge would be updating read-write fields for the in scope roles
  • All backend custom logic during insert/ delete/ replace will get executed as applicable for the Sales Concierge scope as well
Acceptance Criteria: • As part of the user story, the Unit testing of Sales team roles add/delete actions will be taken in scope

The Sales Concierge has come up with an initiative to automate the emailing process to reduce the manual efforts of Sales Ops team. As part of intent 4 requirement for MMS Access, Sales Concierge Team is adding in scope roles on different levels (Opportunity Level). The team will be subscribing to Data Fabric to consume Read Only and ReadWrite fields of MMS.

 

Important Notes

  • Sales Concierge will have access to all the MMS Opportunities under which roles that are in scope will be created/deleted/replaced
  • Sales Concierge would be updating read-write fields for the in-scope roles
  • All backend custom logic during insert/ delete/ replace will get executed as applicable for the Sales Concierge scope as well

Title: [TEST] - Opportunity - NBM Approver Insights - Minor Approver Insights Updates
Description:
Few modifications in the chapter 6 of US 233379 (linked as related)

  1. "Flippable" tiles (ADR, Dynamic Target ADR, CCI%, Dynamic Target CCI%) can have a positive value in the front but negative values in the back, and vice versa. What should be the behavior of the health toggle in this scenarios?
    Answer:  the tiles to be displayed in Strong or Weak should be based on the default/front side of the tile. 
    For example, if Dynamic Target CCI% has Variance to Target = positive and CCI% has Variance to Target = negative, display the tile in Strong since the default/front side is positive. If the user flips the tile, since the back side is negative, the left line will be red instead of green.

  2. Scenario: AHR tile has Variance to Target = positive, ADR tile has Variance to Target = positive.
    Answer: If user switches to Daily Rate while the Strong toggle is selected, the Strong toggle should remain selected, the AHR tile should disappear and the ADR tile should take place.

  3. In solution contingency tile, there is no green color logic used but in US its mentioned, green for strong and red for weak so what should be the behavior now?
    Answer: After talking to the business it was determined that the coloring logic for the solution contingency tile should depend on the coloring of the icon in the SC Deviation Amount Icon field in the opportunity page following the next logic:

SC Deviation Amount Icon color=green ; NBM Approver Insights= green
SC Deviation Amount Icon color=yellow; NBM Approver Insights= yellow
SC Deviation Amount Icon color=red ; NBM Approver Insights= red
SC Deviation Amount Icon color= 'Blank' ; NBM Approver Insights= black

currently the logic is only using Yellow, black and Red, so if green gets added

Title: [Tech Debt] [SF] Sharing Not Set on Apex Classes - Sharing Should Be Configured on Classes with DML - Marketing
Acceptance Criteria:
We identify classes without the keyword "with sharing" or "without sharing".
An omitted sharing declaration runs as without sharing by default. As a best practice, developers should explicitly set a sharing declaration on every Apex Class, specifically those classes that contains DML.

Title: [SF] Assign cases automatically to CPA Team

US DOCUMENT


AS CPA Manager from Pricing Support,

I WANT cases that needs to be assign to CPA team to be automatically assigned,

SO THAT I can manage the requests that needs CPA support.

Title: [TEST] intent 1 for the changes of other competitor- Regression test script prep
Description:
To build the solution for MMS - Sales concierge Integration to update the Competitor (If Other) when the request comes from Sales Concierge Integration.

For error “Update failed. First exception on row 0 with id a2aHs000003DAGWIA4; first error: FIELD_CUSTOM_VALIDATION_EXCEPTION, You must enter the Other Competitor name”
This validation message is from the custom logic in MMS. When the user tries to update the LostTo field in WinLoss, there is a custom logic that validates whether the LostTo (competitor name) provided already exists in the list of competitors (Related List - Competitors) listed under the opportunity.
Acceptance Criteria:
• MMS will update Competitor (If Other) with the value that will be received in the Inbound request when the WinLoss.Losto Name is OTHERS.
  • Datatype of Competitor (If Other) is Text(255)
  • Field : Incumbent Type (Object : Competitor)  - This field value is required during insertion. Currently, in MMS competitor record gets inserted with "Not an Incumbent" value. For Competitor "OTHERS" as well, record will get inserted with "Not an Incumbent" value.
New field(s) to be added to the JSON

Title: [SF] FE: Creation of Consents & Preferences Check Solutioning for Lead and Client
Description:
Following solution needs to be created:
  1. Create a button “Lead Consent & Preference Check Report” on the list view page of Leads and “Client Consent & Preference Check Report on the list view page of Contacts
  2. On clicking the required button, a page should open consisting of three radio buttons for Lead/Client ID, Enterprise ID, and Name and a Next button. A page with text field to enter the value of the selected radio button should appear when the user chooses a radio button based on the requirement and click on the Next button.
  3. User can navigate back to Previous page having radio buttons using “Previous” Button.
  4. Users can also export the report in excel using “Export Data” button.

Title: [SF] Integration Request for SC - Intent 4.1 Sales Team validation - ADD Part 2
Description:
Requirements Section

The Sales Concierge has come up with an initiative to automate the emailing process to reduce the manual efforts of Sales Ops team. As part of the intent 4 requirement for MMS Access, Sales Concierge Team is adding in scope roles on different levels (Opportunity Level). The team will be subscribing to Data Fabric to consume the Read Only and ReadWrite fields of MMS.

 

Important Notes

  • Sales Concierge will have access to all the MMS accounts and Opportunities under which roles that are in scope will be created
  • Sales Concierge would be updating read-write fields for the in scope roles
  • All backend custom logic during insert/delete will get executed as applicable for the Sales Concierge scope as well
Acceptance Criteria:
• Mandatory details for roles and for add operations are as follows:
  • For add- Role name and Enterprise ID
  • For add- Role name of only in scope roles will be inserted
  • Only valid records, i.e. record having valid enterprise ID (active emp status and active MMS user status) and valid role would be considered for insert. For invalid records an error response will be sent
  • Following are the additional validations to be built on SalesteamApprovedUser object against the following in scope roles
    • Validations on the role Pricing Architect: Enterprise Id that user tries to add against the Role "Pricing Architect"  should be present in SalesTeamApprovedUsers__C with same role name with  "Active" status (InactiveInd__c = false ). EID that the user tries to add should be with  Active / null Employment status in MMS. (People Object )
    • Validations on the role Financial Architect: Enterprise Id that user tries to add against the Role "Financial Architect"  should be present in SalesTeamApprovedUsers__C with same role name with  "Active" status (InactiveInd__c = false ). EID that the user tries to add should be with  Active / null Employment status in MMS. (People Object )
    • Validations on the role Transformation Director: Enterprise Id that user tries to add against the Role "Transformation Director"  should be present in SalesTeamApprovedUsers__C with same role name with  "Active" status (InactiveInd__c = false ). EID that the user tries to add should be with  Active / null Employment status in MMS. (People Object )
  • Following are the validations built on the QA Director role
    • Opportunity QA Director cannot be the same as Client Account Lead
    • Opportunity QA Director cannot be the same as Sales Capture
    • There can only be one Opportunity QA Director to be added to Sales Team UI. In order to replace, the existing Opportunity QA Director needs to be removed
    • EID added to Opportunity Sales Team role should have JobCd = 10000025

Description:
Requirements Section

The Sales Concierge has come up with an initiative to automate the emailing process to reduce the manual efforts of Sales Ops team. As part of the intent 4 requirement for MMS Access, Sales Concierge Team is adding in scope roles on different levels (Opportunity Level). The team will be subscribing to Data Fabric to consume the Read Only and ReadWrite fields of MMS.

 

Important Notes

  • Sales Concierge will have access to all the MMS accounts under which roles that are in scope will be created
  • Account plan access and client feedback will be provided by Sales Concierge
  • Sales Concierge would be updating read-write fields for the in scope roles
  • All backend custom logic during insert/ delete/ replace will get executed as applicable for the Sales Concierge scope as well
Acceptance Criteria:
• As part of this user story, flow sequencing for the below actions during insertion or deletion of the roles:
                      a. Validate the role
                      b. Insert the role
                      c. Validate the role
                      d. Delete the role

Title: [TEST][Monitoring Application] AWS Monitoring Application Initialized/Configured to Process Data
Description:
Description: 

In the flow of the surveys through the monitoring process, both MMS and Qualtrics send their information to the Data Fabric which will send it to DynamoDB. The data sent should be stored in DynamoDB within the correct tables/in the correct schema. Here the MonitoringStatus should be listed as 'New' 

The data is then sent to the Monitoring Application to check for direct matches. 

 The Monitoring Application will look for a survey match from MMS and a Survey match from Qualtrics - 

 IF a match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Closed'

 IF NO match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Active'
Acceptance Criteria:
Acceptance Criteria:
-AWS Configured to accept MMS and Qualtrics data daily from Data Fabric into Dynamo DB Storage
-AWS Monitoring application created and configured to run daily batch job to identify and report the following discrepancies using the fields indicated:




Discrepancy Types:
-Difference in Response Count 
-Missing ResponseID (Missing in either Qualtrics or MMS)
-Duplicate ResponseID (Identify which response ID are duplicates)

Example of Generated Report:
See attachment for all scenarios/report formatting

Title: [TEST][Monitoring Application] AWS Monitoring Application Configured for Daily Email Notification
Description:
Description:

In the flow of the surveys through the monitoring process, both MMS and Qualtrics send their information to the Data Fabric which will send it to DynamoDB. The data sent should be stored in DynamoDB within the correct tables/in the correct schema. Here the MonitoringStatus should be listed as 'New'  

The data is then sent to the Monitoring Application to check for direct matches. 

The Monitoring Application will look for a survey match from MMS and a Survey match from Qualtrics - 

IF a match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Closed'

IF NO match is found - the MonitoringStatus field should be listed as 'Active' 

 

 Once the Monitoring Application has run:

-An email notification that will alert business users of the discrepancy records IF a discrepancy has been detected in the last 24 hours (MonitoringStatus = "Active") (Email template provided below)
Acceptance Criteria:
Acceptance Criteria:
-Daily batch job that that will send an email to 
CIO.ClientSuccess.Support from: DoNotReply_ClientSuccessSupport@accenture.com
with the discrepancy records IF a discrepancy has been detected in the last 24 hours (MonitoringStatus = "Active") (Email template provided below) (See Schema attachment for format) 


Example of Email Notification to be Sent

  3. SC will insert Notes under all the Accounts and Opportunities that are processed through SC.
Acceptance Criteria:
As a part of this story, MMS needs to build the Notes structure on the proposed format based on the request received from SC inbound request for all the Request type (Add, Replace, Delete)

SC will insert Notes under all the Accounts and Opportunities that are processed through SC.

Title: [INT] CX - Deletion of Surveys in MMS need to trigger a deletion in DynamoDB
Description:
This is needed to support the monitoring feature

We need to add a new value in CS plan status picklist.

Object: ClientSatisfactionPlan__c
Field: CX Plan status (CSPlanStatus__c)
New value is: “Delete”

9/22/23 - After speaking with the business, there is already a manual delete process in place to delete duplicate records in MMS. There is no need to add the 'Delete' option in the CX Plan Status dropdown. 

However, there is a scenario that still needs to be addressed, which is why this story and requirements have changed. 

If there are 2 duplicate records added into DynamoDB (MonitoringStatus = 'Active'), and they have been identified as duplicates and are going to be deleted in MMS --> They must also be deleted in DynamoDB (Message must be published to DataFabric) or else they will remain there as a discrepancy with the 'Active' Status. 

The Delete button in MMS must do this (in this exact order, or we'll lose data):
  1. Trigger Message publish to DF that the record has been deleted and to delete in DynamoDB on Delete (Trigger) in MMS
  2. delete the actual record in MMS backend.
Acceptance Criteria:
The Delete button in MMS must do this (in this exact order, or we'll lose data):
  1. Trigger Message publish to DF that the record has been deleted and to delete in DynamoDB on Delete (Trigger) in MMS
  2. delete the actual record in MMS backend.

Title: [POC] [SF] FE: POC for M&C Tower Lead/Contact Creation/Update solutioning analysis- Part 3
Description:
Requirement overview:A solutioning is needed where a file needs to be fetched from the SharePoint location and the records are compared with the records in MMS, After performing Duplicate checks, The record is saved, updated or discarded as per the condition. After the insertion, a success or Failure results needs to be provided against each record.
Feasibility of Below points needs to be checked:

  1. If we have more than one record for first name + last name + account OR first name(nickname) + last name- + account OR first name + last name OR first name (nickname) + last name is same, then record status should be updated accordingly against that record so that CDM team can know that this record needs to be updated  manually.
  2. If the value in MMS is blank then for request type='Update' , new value from CDM should not get updated instead it should remain as it is.
Acceptance Criteria:
1. If we have more than one record for first name + last name + account OR first name(nickname) + last name- + account OR first name + last name OR first name (nickname) + last name is same, then record status should be updated. accordingly against that record so that CDM team can update the record manually.
  2. If the value in MMS is blank then for request type='Update' , new value from CDM should not get updated instead it should remain as it is.

Title: [FA] Creation Action Page: Create and Track an Action
Description:
Action tracking is a new functionality we are introducing that builds on the current close the loop functionality. Currently, business stakeholders receive a notification (nudge) that they have client feedback waiting for them in Discover. This feedback could be something that is lengthy/verbose/extremely positive/extremely negative. The next step is for the user to click on the nudge and review that feedback. Once the feedback is viewed, the stakeholders do not have a way to track next steps/any actions on this feedback, that is where this feature comes into play. This feature allows stakeholders to review client feedback, create a follow up action, and then track that follow up action. 

This functionality will be using Qualtrics' ticketing / action planning module. 


This story covers the pages that allow for a follow up action to be created and then for that action to be tracked on the myACT dashboard. This button should lead to another page that allows users to enter in details for their task and save. 

Once the task is saved, it should be come up on the list of tasks associated with that Master Account.  


"As a User, I want to be able to create an Action and link it to a CX Plan automatically. I should be able to assign it to my self or to my team members/delegates, so we can track and work on it.

Additional Info:
Form Fields - to be confirmed"


Add in something to go back/exit out of this 

POC:
Acceptance Criteria:
Button on myACT page that links to a new Action Page
Create New Action page with the following entries/text boxes: 
  • Plan Name
  • Description 
  • Due Date
  • Owner
Save button/Create task 

Task should save and should be associated with the Master Client and should be shown in the full task list.
